sub_topic: Determining the length of a side in an isosceles triangle.
message_1: In an isosceles triangle, the length of the two equal sides is 10 cm, and the length of the base is 6 cm. What is the length of each equal side?
message_2: In an isosceles triangle, the two equal sides have the same length. Since the length of the two equal sides is given as 10 cm, each equal side has a length of 10/2 = 5 cm.
